com.bluegosling.concurrent.executors

Class InterceptingExecutorService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.concurrent.executors.WrappingExecutor
      • com.bluegosling.concurrent.executors.WrappingExecutorService
        • com.bluegosling.concurrent.executors.InterceptingExecutorService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FluentExecutorService, com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningExecutorService, Executor, ExecutorService
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InterceptingScheduledExecutorService

    public class InterceptingExecutorService
extends WrappingExecutorService
    An executor service that provides an interceptor pattern, to apply cross-cutting concerns in the course of executing tasks. This is identical to InterceptingExecutor except that it implements the full ExecutorService interface, and requires the underlying executor to do so also.

    Two different styles of interceptor are supported:

    • InterceptingExecutorService.Interceptor: Can intercept all invocations of tasks and even choose to short-circuit their execution.
    • InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator: Can decorate invocations with actions that are performed before and after the execution of a task. Short-circuiting actual execution is not directly supported. Execution of multiple decorators can be done in a single stack-frame, so their use can lead to friendlier stack traces than the use of interceptors.
